column4: I'm trying to force the version of plymouth in synaptic and it won't let me fall back to the original one that's included in Lucid.
you mean an actual version difference? or you mean theme name?
version difference...  I switched to a PPA version and now I can't switch back.
oh, i see. have you gotten rid of the ppa from your software sources list?
Yes.
ok. is the original .deb still in your /ver/cache/apt/archive directory?
/VAR*
/var/cache/apt/archives  ...sorry
you still here?
cache is clear.
ok, just go here and down at the bottom left under where it says 'Architecture' you can download the lucid plymouth .deb
http://packages.ubuntu.com/lucid/plymouth
download that then you can try and install it on command line and see what happens
plymouth depends on libplymouth2 (= 0.8.2-2ubuntu2); however:  Version of libplymouth2 on system is 0.8.2-2ubuntu3~ppa1.

roger... download that from website. if you just go to http://packages.ubuntu.com/ then you can do a search on package name. then click on the 'lucid' link and it'll take you to the page where you can download the .deb file
so, in other words... download the .deb for the 'libplymouth2' for standard lucid from there
Thanks!  I'm trying that right now.
you might have to get a few more also.. you're welcome
if you want to 'force' a package to install, i can tell you how. or you can look at then man page for 'dpkg'
The one question I have is how do I get the default plymouth theme back?  that seems to have been lost somewhere in this process.
i'm not sure... trying to look
gonna try rebooting now.  brb
i don't know. perhaps install 'plymouth-theme-ubuntu-logo'? don't really know what the default one is. mine is ubuntu-studio
roger.. good luck!
